page.title: 14TRANSPORT AROUND FROXFIELD 1
page.content: TRAVELLING to and from the home in the country is made easier for many people by the operation of a regular Post Office Bus service. Nearly 200 Post Buses in Britain which collect and deliver mail, also carry fare-paying passengers where there is no other public transport. The first Post Bus was introduced in l967 and the network is still growing. Before the Post Bus there was never any other service such as this. Because the Post Office had to make collections around Froxfield, Langrish and Petersfield anyway, and there is no other service in the area, they decided to run their own special service. The Post Bus can hold up to eleven adults, and is particularly busy on market days, and half day on Saturdays.
